intro: Paepalanthus archeri, commonly known as the desert lily, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of South America. It is characterized by its striking, showy flowers that bloom in the evening, attracting nocturnal pollinators such as moths. The plant has adapted to extreme drought conditions with a deep root system and succulent leaves that store water. Its flowers are typically pale yellow or greenish-white, with a tubular shape that facilitates pollination by long-tongued insects. Paepalanthus archeri is often found in rocky soils and plays a role in stabilizing desert ecosystems.
